qas.question: What modern religion sometimes uses Old English?
What hobby champions the use of Old English?
Along with Tolkien, what modern scholar notably made use of Old English?
What Wikipedia project makes use of the Old English language?
What is a term for modern texts written in Old English?
What is one of the few languages imitated by scholars?
What author promoted the active use of Old English?
What Wikipedia project translate Old English texts?

plausible_answers.text: Alistair Campbell and J. R. R. Tolkien

qas.question: What modern authors wrote exclusively in Old English?

context: Like other historical languages, <b5_0>Old English<b5_0/> has been used by scholars and enthusiasts of later periods to create texts either imitating Anglo-Saxon literature or deliberately transferring it to a different cultural context. Examples include <a2_0><b8_0>Alistair Campbell<a2_0/> and <b6_0>J. R. R. Tolkien<b8_0/><b6_0/>. A number of websites devoted to <a0_0>Neo-Paganism<a0_0/> and <a1_0>Historical re-enactment<a1_0/> offer reference material and forums promoting the active use of Old English. By far the most ambitious project[peacock term] is <a3_0><b7_0>the Old English Wikipedia<b7_0/><a3_0/>, but most of the <a4_0>Neo-Old English<a4_0/> texts published online bear little resemblance to the historical model and are riddled with very basic grammatical mistakes.
